task.title: Backing up
task.shortdesc: Using the browser interface, you can take a backup of an application that manages.

context.p:
Review considerations and best practices before performing an application backup:
Perform regular backups of the production environment and potentially the system of record from the initial deployment. Back up to nonactive resource targets such as a separate DR system or test environment. Store backups on a machine other than the master. Copy or migrate backups to an off-system location for safekeeping and to help regulate storage space usage on the master.
The backup process saves a snapshot of the current state of the system, the state of all services, and data to a compressed archive file (.tgz). When a backup is running, you can start and restart services.

step.cmd: Log in to the browser interface.
Click the Backup / Restore tab. The Backup / Restore page appears.
Click Create Backup. You are asked to confirm your selection by clicking Create Backup again.
step.stepresult: When the backup is complete, the path of the backup file is displayed.
